physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient reported pulling scalp hairs up to 3 hours per day, with her scalp nearly totally bald, including areas of scarring and scabs.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Physical findings related to hair pulling persisted with periods of exacerbation and less frequent episodes after treatment interventions.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Hair-pulling episodes reduced to 2-3 per day, total less than 10 hairs pulled.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial improvement observed in hair pulling frequency and subjective experience of urges.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Increased hair pulling from scalp to legs occurred, with relapse linked to stress.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Setback noted in hair pulling severity attributed to increased stress.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Hair pulling reduced to MGH Hair-pulling Scale score of 4; continued use of lorazepam.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Further improvement in hair pulling frequency and psychological symptom scores.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient had given up her wig and had short, thin but full hair.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Significant recovery and return of hair coverage after combined therapy.
